cluster.synopsis: Group of commands used to manage clusters.
cluster.description: Group of commands used to manage clusters.

Global Options.description: file at which Nerd will look for Kubernetes credentials
duration for which Nerd will wait for Kubernetes

cluster list.synopsis: Returns an overview of your clusters.
cluster list.description: Returns an overview of your clusters.

Global Options.description: file at which Nerd will look for Kubernetes credentials
duration for which Nerd will wait for Kubernetes

cluster use.synopsis: Set a specific cluster as the current one to use.
cluster use.description: Set a specific cluster as the current one to use.

Global Options.description: file at which Nerd will look for Kubernetes credentials
duration for which Nerd will wait for Kubernetes

Options.description: set a specific namespace as the default one

dataset.synopsis: Group of commands used to manage datasets (collection of files).
dataset.description: Group of commands used to manage datasets. A dataset is a collection of files, like a folder on a computer. They can be used as input for a job and, when an application creates output files, these can be automatically stored in a new dataset.

Global Options.description: file at which Nerd will look for Kubernetes credentials
duration for which Nerd will wait for Kubernetes

dataset delete.synopsis: Remove a dataset from the cluster.
dataset delete.description: Remove a dataset from the cluster.

Global Options.description: file at which Nerd will look for Kubernetes credentials
duration for which Nerd will wait for Kubernetes

Options.description: delete all your datasets in one command

dataset download.synopsis: Download results from a running job.
dataset download.description: Download results from a running job.

Global Options.description: file at which Nerd will look for Kubernetes credentials
duration for which Nerd will wait for Kubernetes

Options.description: specify a job name where the datasets were used as its input. Dataset name is no longer mandatory.
specify a job name where the datasets were used as its output. Dataset name is no longer mandatory.

dataset list.synopsis: Return datasets that are managed by the cluster.
dataset list.description: Return datasets that are managed by the cluster.

Global Options.description: file at which Nerd will look for Kubernetes credentials
duration for which Nerd will wait for Kubernetes

dataset upload.synopsis: Upload a dataset to your compute cluster.
dataset upload.description: Upload a dataset to your compute cluster.

Advanced Options.description: S3 Bucket name that will be used for dataset storage
AWS region used for dataset storage
access key used for auth with the storage backend
secret key for auth with the storage backend
temporary auth token for the storage backend
store this dataset under a specific prefix

Global Options.description: file at which Nerd will look for Kubernetes credentials
duration for which Nerd will wait for Kubernetes

Options.description: assign a name to the dataset

job.synopsis: Group of commands used to manage the lifecycle of jobs.
job.description: Group of commands used to manage the lifecycle of jobs. A job is a computation that takes some input data, runs an application to do operations on this data and stores the results.

Global Options.description: file at which Nerd will look for Kubernetes credentials
duration for which Nerd will wait for Kubernetes

job delete.synopsis: Remove one or more job(s) from the cluster.
job delete.description: Remove one or more job(s) from the cluster.

Global Options.description: file at which Nerd will look for Kubernetes credentials
duration for which Nerd will wait for Kubernetes

Options.description: delete all your jobs in one command

job list.synopsis: Return jobs that are managed by the cluster.
job list.description: Return jobs that are managed by the cluster.

Global Options.description: file at which Nerd will look for Kubernetes credentials
duration for which Nerd will wait for Kubernetes

job logs.synopsis: Return logs for a running job.
job logs.description: Return logs for a running job.

Global Options.description: file at which Nerd will look for Kubernetes credentials
duration for which Nerd will wait for Kubernetes

Options.description: only return the oldest N lines of the process logs

job run.synopsis: Run a job on your compute cluster.
job run.description: Run a job on your compute cluster.

Advanced Options.description: S3 Bucket name that will be used for dataset storage
AWS region used for dataset storage
access key used for auth with the storage backend
secret key for auth with the storage backend
temporary auth token for the storage backend
store this dataset under a specific prefix

Global Options.description: file at which Nerd will look for Kubernetes credentials
duration for which Nerd will wait for Kubernetes

Options.description: assign a name to the job
memory to use for this job, expressed in gigabytes
number of vcpus to use for this job
specify one or more inputs that will be used for the job using the following format: <DIR|DATASET_NAME>:<JOB_DIR>
specify one or more output folders that will be stored as datasets after the job is finished using the following format: <DATASET_NAME>:<JOB_DIR>

use this flag with a private image, a prompt will ask for your username and password of the repository that stores the image. If NERD_IMAGE_USERNAME and/or NERD_IMAGE_PASSWORD environment variables are set, those values are used instead.

to be used with the '--private' flag, a prompt will ask again for your image repository username and password. If NERD_IMAGE_USERNAME and/or NERD_IMAGE_PASSWORD environment variables are provided, they will be used as values to update the secret.

Global Options.description: file at which Nerd will look for Kubernetes credentials
duration for which Nerd will wait for Kubernetes

Options.description: type of configuration to use (from env, endpoint, or oidc)
